page.title: 14BURNHEAD TOWER.
page.content: The tower was built in l487 just under 5OO years ago. The tower was built of stone on the flat because if the tower was built of wood and raised from the ground it would be easy to set alight. The tower was owned by James Scott and built by him. In the years of the Border raids all the men and boys were killed. There was only one person left in the tower and she married a man called Watson and that is how the owner's name was changed to Scott-Watson. The house that is joined onto the tower was built in the l7OO's. At the top of the tower is a sort of ledge that they would light a fire on and that would warn the other towers that the English were approaching. The door opened outwards and it was made of iron so that it could not be rammed down with a big trunk.
